result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LYLE J ACHTERBERG

records.addlTxt: Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement (3 years)

4:01 PM Defendant LYLE J ACHTERBERG in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for LYLE J ACHTERBERG. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to one count of failure to support and enter into a deferred entry of judgment agreement. ADA concurs and the other counts will be dismissed and read-in. Atty Kapelis concurs,. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and orders counts 2,3 & 4 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be withheld and adjourns matter pending compliance with the terms of the deferred entry of judgment agreement - 3 years. 

Court adjourned at 4:07 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:08 AM Defendant LYLE J ACHTERBERG appeared in court, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for LYLE J ACHTERBERG, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states the def would like to waive the right to a prelim. Def concurs - will waive right to prelim. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date June 6, 2022 at 10:30 Am.

Court Adjourned at 10:11 AM.
Return date scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Information document has been moved on the court record to "after" the hearing.
Notice of Hearing for Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 08, 2022 at 10:00 AM has been returned. / Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as Addressed. Unable to Forward.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing for Second Appearance set for March 08, 2022 at 10:00 AM has been returned. / Return to Sender. Not deliverable as addressed. Unable to forward.
Second appearance on March 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:51 AM Defendant LYLE J ACHTERBERG appeared in court, Attorney Michael Kapelis appears in court for the defendant, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def qualifies for the public defender. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests preliminary hearing.. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Defendant waives the time limits for the prelim. Court will set for Status of Attorney and Status of Prelim  March 08, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:52 AM.

Defendant called Clerk of Courts and stated he was told by a family member that he has court tomorrow.  He stated he has not received a copy of summons and complaint and that the address and phone number on file are not current, so he updated his address and telephone number. Defendant was instructed to stop at the Clerk of Courts office, on his way to court tomorrow, to pick up a copy of his complaint.
